definition: to work hard
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work

sentences.english: My husband knew how to work hard and smart.
sentences.chinese: 我的丈夫懂得如何苦幹加巧幹。

sentences.english: Do you plod through the day at the office?
sentences.chinese: 你是否在辦公室裏埋頭苦幹了一整天呢？

sentences.english: From the company now has been set up to work hard with the spirit of hard work go now.
sentences.chinese: 從公司成立到現在一直憑着苦幹實幹的精神走到現在。

sentences.english: I like your down-to-earth and hardworking spirit.
sentences.chinese: 我就喜歡你們這股紮紮實實埋頭苦幹的勁兒。

sentences.english: Painstaking painter was hired to paint a wall of the palace .
sentences.chinese: 一個苦幹的畫家被僱傭去描繪宮殿的一面牆。

sentences.english: It cost him three years of toil to win.
He reacquired an academic reputation after five years of hard work.
sentences.chinese: 經過了五年的苦幹，他重新贏得了學術上的威望。

sentences.english: Humanely but has never stopped working hard.
sentences.chinese: 但入道以來沒有停止過苦幹。

sentences.english: It often takes five or six years of hard work to compile  a good dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 編一部好的詞典常常需要苦幹五六年。

sentences.english: Toiling away at a job you hate may eat away at your happiness over time.
sentences.chinese: 埋頭苦幹一項你痛恨的工作可能會逐漸侵蝕你的快樂。

sentences.english: Firm and steadly, guietly works hard, makes the drip contribution for the society.
sentences.chinese: 堅毅踏實，埋頭苦幹，爲社會作出點滴貢獻。

sentences.english: Your quiet hard work will command respect.
sentences.chinese: 你那埋頭苦幹的精神令人尊敬。

sentences.english: In an agricultural and industrial era, hard work was crucial.
sentences.chinese: 在農業和工業時代，埋頭苦幹是最重要的素質。

sentences.english: We have to put our nose to the grindstone if we want to finish painting the house today.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們今天想把房子漆完就得埋頭苦幹。

sentences.english: She kept at it so hard all day, perspiration made her short hair cling to her brows.
sentences.chinese: 她整天堅持苦幹，以致汗水把她的短髮粘在眉毛上。

sentences.english: He slogged away at that report for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他埋頭苦幹了幾個星期寫那份報告。

definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
proficiency in a particular field (idiom)/skill in a specialized area (idiom)
diligent and attentive/assiduous/sincere
part work, part study/work-study program
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to be reluctant to give up a post
one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable
pinyin: yi1 bu4 yi1 ge4 jiao3 yin4

definition: not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to struggle arduously
industrious and conscientious/assiduous
to force someone to do something
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
industrious and hard-working/conscientious and meticulous
